summary.long: 1 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes, our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God which is at Corinth, to those that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be holy, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be unto you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God always on your behalf for the grace of God which is given you in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that in every thing ye are enriched in him in all word and in all knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with which the testimony of the Christ was confirmed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that ye lack nothing in any gift, waiting for the manifestation of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall also confirm that ye shall remain unimpeachable unto the end, in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is faithful, by whom ye were called into the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing and that there be no divisions among you, but that ye be perfect, joined together in the same understanding and in the same perception.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it has been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by those of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In other words, that each one of you says, I am of Paul, and I of Apollos, and I of Cephas, and I of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized into the name of Paul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest any should say that ye were baptized into my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas; besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with wisdom of words, lest the cross {Gr. stauros – stake} of Christ should be made void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the word of the cross {Gr. stauros – stake} is foolishness to those that perish, but unto us who are saved, it is the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the philosopher of this world? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the wisdom of God, since the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save those that believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we preach Christ crucified, {Gr. Stauroo – hung on a stake} unto the Jews a stumblingblock and unto the Gentiles foolishness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but unto those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For that which is foolish of God is wiser than men, and that which is weak of God is stronger than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For look upon your vocation, brothers, that ye are not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but rather God has chosen that which is the foolishness of the world to confound the wise, and God has chosen that which is the weakness of the world to put to shame the things which are mighty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that which is vile of the world and that which is despised God has chosen, and things which are not, to bring to nought the things that are,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no flesh should glory in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of him ye are reborn in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom and righteousness and sanctification and redemption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that, according as it is written, He that glories, let him glory in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, brothers, when I came to you, came not with puffed up speech or wisdom to declare unto you the testimony of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I judged not to know anything among you, except Jesus Christ and him crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my speech and my preaching was not with enticing words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that your faith should not be founded in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we speak perfect wisdom of God, and not the wisdom of this age nor of the princes of this age, that come to nought,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, even the hidden wisdom, which God predestined before the ages unto our glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which none of the princes of this age knew (for had they known it, they would never have crucified the Lord of glory).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as it is written, That which eye has not seen nor ear heard neither has entered into the heart of man is that which God has prepared for those that love him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God has revealed this unto us by his Spirit, for the Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who among men knows the things of man, except the spirit of man which is in him? Even so no one has known the things of God, but the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we have not received the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is of God, that we might know the things that God has given us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which things also we speak, not in the words which man’s wisdom teaches, but with doctrine of the Holy Spirit, jointly fitting spiritual things by spiritual means.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the natural man does not perceive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness unto him; neither can he understand them because they are spiritually discerned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that is spiritual discerns all things, yet he is discerned by no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who has known the understanding of the Lord? Who has instructed him? But we have the understanding of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, brothers, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fed you with milk, and not with solid food, for until now ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying and strife and divisions, are ye not carnal and walk as men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For while one says, I am of Paul, and another, I am of Apollos, are ye not carnal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who then is Paul? and who is Apollos? but servants by whom ye believed, each one according to that which the Lord gave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then neither is he that plants anything, neither he that waters, but God that gives the increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he that plants and he that waters are one although each one shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are labourers together with God; ye are God’s husbandry, ye are God’s building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another builds upon it. But let each one see how the building is built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one can lay another foundation than that laid, which is Jesus the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if anyone builds upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the work of each one shall be made manifest, for the day shall declare it because it shall be revealed by fire; the work of each one, whatever sort it is, the fire shall put it to test.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the work of anyone abides which he has built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss, but he himself shall be saved, yet so as by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone defiles the temple of God, God shall destroy that one; for the temple of God is holy, which temple ye are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive himself. If any one among you seems to be wise in this age, let them become a fool that they may be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He takes the wise in their own craftiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again, The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let no one glory in men. For all things are yours;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things to come, all are yours;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye are Christ’s; and Christ is God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us reckon men as ministers of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, it is required in stewards that each one be found faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by man’s judgment; I do not even judge my own self.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For although I have nothing on my conscience, yet am I not hereby justified, but he that judges me is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts; and then shall each one have praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollos for your sakes, that in us ye might not learn above that which is written, lest because of one, some of you become puffed up against others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who makes thee to judge? and what hast thou that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receive it, what dost thou glory of, as if thou hadst not received it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye reign as kings without us, and I wish ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I think that God has set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death; for we are made a spectacle unto the world and to angels and to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are fools for Christ’s sake, but ye are prudent in Christ; we are weak, but ye are strong; ye are honourable, but we are despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even unto this present hour we both hunger and thirst and are ill clad and are buffeted and have no certain dwelling place
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and labour, working with our own hands; being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being blasphemed, we intreat; we are made as the filth of this world and are the offscouring of all things unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not write these things to shame you, but to warn you, as to my beloved sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though ye may have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet ye shall not have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I beseech you that ye imitate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause I have sent Timothy unto you, who is my beloved son and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some are puffed up as though I will never come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord wills, and will know not the words of those who are puffed up, but the virtue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the kingdom of God is not in words, but in virtue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will ye? Shall I come unto you with a rod or in charity and in the spirit of meekness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is reported commonly that there is fornication among you, and such fornication as is not so much as named among the Gentiles, that one should have his father’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye are puffed up and have not rather mourned, that he that has done this deed might be taken away from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have judged already, as though I were present, him that has so done this deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let such a one be delivered unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your glorying is not good. Know ye not that a little leaven leavens the whole lump?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Purge out therefore the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened. For even Christ, our passover, is sacrificed for us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore let us celebrate the feast, not in the old leaven, neither in the leaven of malice and wickedness, but in the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to associate with fornicators,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world or with the covetous or extortioners or with idolaters, for then ye would need to go out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I have written unto you not to associate with anyone calling himself a brother if he is a fornicator or covetous or an idolater or a railer or a drunkard or an extortioner; with such a one do not even eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For why shall I judge those that are without? do ye not judge those that are within?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those that are without, God shall judge. Therefore, put away from among yourselves that wicked person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go unto judgment before the unjust, and not before the saints?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more the things that pertain to this life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then ye have judgments of things pertaining to this life, set as judges the most humble who are in the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you? no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brothers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But brother goes to judgment against brother, and that before the unbelievers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore there is certainly a fault among you, because ye go to law one with another. Why do ye not rather suffer the wrong? why do ye not rather be defrauded?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye do wrong and defraud and do this to your brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye not that the unjust shall not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not err: neither fornicators nor idolaters nor adulterers nor effeminate nor homosexuals
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor thieves nor covetous nor drunkards nor revilers nor extortioners shall inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And such were some of you, but now ye are washed, but now ye are sanctified, but now ye are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus and in the Spirit of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient; all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foods are for the belly, and the belly for foods; but God shall destroy both it and them. Now the body is not for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God, who raised up the Lord, will also raise up us by his own power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make them the members of a harlot? In no wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? know ye not that he who is joined to the harlot is one body with her? For they shall be, saith he, two in one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flee fornication. Any other sin that a man does is outside the body, but he that commits fornication sins against his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom ye have of God, and that ye are not your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are bought with a price, therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the things of which ye wrote unto me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, to avoid fornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence, and likewise also the wife unto the husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife does not have authority of her own body, but the husband; and likewise also the husband does not have authority of his own body, but the wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not defraud one another, except it be with mutual consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer and come together again, that Satan not tempt you for your incontinency.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I speak this by permission, and not by commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But each one has his own gift from God, one after this manner and another after that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say, therefore, to the unmarried men and widowers, It is good for them if they abide even as I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not have the gift of continence, let them marry, for it is better to marry than to burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto the married I command, yet not I, but the Lord, Let not the wife separate from her husband;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if she separates, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband, and let not the husband put away his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the rest I speak, not the Lord: If any brother has a wife that does not believe, and she consents to dwell with him, let him not put her away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman who has a husband that does not believe and if he consents to dwell with her, let her not leave him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband; otherwise your children would be unclean, but now they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the unbelieving spouse separates, let them separate. The brother or the sister is not under slavery in such cases, but God has called us to peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save thy husband? or what knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save thy wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as God has distributed to each one, as the Lord has called each one, so let them walk. And so I ordain in all the congregations. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is anyone called being circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Is anyone called in uncircumcision? Let him not be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing but the keeping of the commandments of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let each abide in the same calling in which he was called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou called being a slave? care not for it; but if thou may be made free, use it rather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that is called in the Lord, being a slave, is the Lord’s freeman; likewise also he that is called, being free, is Christ’s slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are bought with a price; do not make yourselves the slaves of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one, brothers, in that state in which he was called, let him abide with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning virgins I have no com­mandment of the Lord, yet I give my advice, as one that has obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hold, therefore, this to be good because of the present distress, that it is good for a man to be thus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou bound unto a wife? Seek not to be loosed. Art thou loosed from a wife? Seek not a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless such shall have affliction in the flesh, but I forbear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I say, brothers, the time is short; for the rest, let those that have wives be as though they had none;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those that weep, as though they wept not; and those that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and those that buy, as though they possessed not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those that use this world, as not using it as their own, for the fashion of this world passes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would have you without worry. He that is unmarried cares for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he that is married cares for the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a difference also between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit; but she that is married cares for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I speak for your own profit, not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is honourable and that ye may attend upon the Lord without impediment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone thinks it uncomely regarding his daughter, if she passes the bloom of life, and need so requires, let him do what he will, he does not sin: let them marry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, he that stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has liberty regarding his own, and has so determined in his heart that he will keep his daughter, does well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then he that gives her in marriage does well, but he that does not give her in marriage does better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband lives; but if her husband dies, she is free and may be married to whom she will, if it is in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she shall be more blessed if she so abides, after my counsel, and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as concerning things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but charity edifies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone thinks that they know anything, they know nothing yet as they ought to know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone loves God, the same is known of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As concerning, therefore, the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though there are some that are called gods, whether in heaven or in the earth (as there are many gods and many lords),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to us there is but one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we in him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit there is not in everyone that knowledge, for some with conscience of the idol unto now, eat it as a thing offered unto an idol, and their conscience being weak is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But food does not make us more acceptable unto God; for neither if we eat are we the better, neither if we eat not are we the worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours becomes a stumblingblock to those that are weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if anyone sees thee who hast this knowledge sit at food in the idol’s temple, shall not the conscience of him who is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through thy knowledge the weak brother shall perish, for whom Christ died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this manner, therefore, sinning against the brethren and wounding their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if food makes my brother to fall, I will never eat flesh nor do anything which may cause my brother to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I not an apostle? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Are not ye my work in the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you, for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My answer to those that examine me is this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we not have authority to eat and to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do we not have authority to bring with us a sister, a wife, as also the other apostles and as the brothers of the Lord and Cephas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do only Barnabas and I not have authority to forbear working?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? or who feeds a flock and does not eat of the milk of the flock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I say this only according to men? or does not the law say the same also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treads out the grain. Does God take care for oxen?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or does he say it altogether for our sakes? For our sakes, no doubt, this is written: that he that plows should plow in hope, and that he that threshes in hope should be partaker of his hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap material things from you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If others are partakers of this authority over you, why not us? Nevertheless we have not used this authority, but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do ye not know that those who work with sacred things live of the things of the sanctuary? and those who serve at the altar partake of the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so the Lord has ordained that those who preach the gospel should live of the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have used none of these things, neither have I written these things that it should be so done unto me; for it were better for me to die than that anyone should make this my glory void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I preach the gospel, I have no reason to glory, for it is an obligation laid upon me; for woe is me, if I do not preach the gospel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward; but if against my will, the stewardship of the gospel is committed unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What reward, then, shall I have? That preaching the gospel, I may make the gospel of the Christ without charge, that I abuse not my authority in the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, though I am free regarding everyone, yet I have made myself slave unto all, that I might gain the more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews; to those that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain those that are under the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to those that are without law, as without law (being not without law of God, but under the law of Christ), that I might gain those that are without law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the weak I became as weak, that I might gain the weak; I am made all things to everyone, that I might by all means save some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might be partaker together of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know ye not that those who run in a race indeed all run, but one receives the prize? So run, that ye may obtain it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every man that strives for the mastery is temperate in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown, but we, an incorruptible one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I therefore so run, not as unto an uncertain thing; so I fight, not as one that beats the air;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I keep my body under, and bring it into subjection, lest preaching to others, I myself should become reprobate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, brothers, I would that ye not ignore how our fathers were all under the cloud and all passed through the sea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did all eat the same spiritual food
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did all drink the same spiritual drink, for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them; and that Rock was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But with many of them God was not pleased; therefore, they were overthrown in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these things became types of us, that we should not lust after evil things as they lusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed and fell dead: in one day, twenty-three thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither let us tempt the Christ, as some of them also tempted and perished by the serpents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured and perished by the destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all these things happened unto them as types, and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let him that thinks he stands take heed lest he fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No temptation has taken you but such as is common to man, but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above what ye are able but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the fellowship of the blood of the Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the fellowship of the body of the Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For one loaf of bread means that many are one body, for we are all partakers of that one loaf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not those who eat of the sacrifices participants of the altar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What do I say then? that the idol is anything or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God; and I would not that ye should be participants of demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; ye cannot be participants of the Lord’s table and of the table of demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient; all things are lawful for me, but all things do not edify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one seek his own good, but that of the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever is sold in the market, that eat, asking no question for conscience sake;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the earth is the Lord’s, and the fullness thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of those that do not believe bid you to a feast, and ye are disposed to go, eat whatever is set before you asking no questions for conscience sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone says unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, do not eat it for the sake of him that disclosed it and for conscience sake; for the earth is the Lord’s, and the fullness thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other, for why should my liberty be judged by another man’s conscience?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I by grace am a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether therefore ye eat or drink or whatever ye do, do everything for the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be without offense, neither to the Jews nor to the Gentiles nor to the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as I please everyone in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ye imitators of me, even as I also am of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I praise you, brothers, that ye remember me in all things and retain my instructions the same as I spoke unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I would have you know that the head of every man is the Christ, and the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonours his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every woman that prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonours her head, for that is even the same as if she were shaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the woman is not covered, let her also be shorn; but if it is a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God; but the woman is the glory of the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the man is not of the woman, but the woman of the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither was the man created for the woman, but the woman for the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause the woman ought to have authority over her head: because of the angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge in yourselves: is it honest that a woman pray unto God uncovered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man lets his hair grow, it is dishonest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a woman lets her hair grow, it is a glory to her; for her hair is given her for a covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With all this, if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not: that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For first of all, when ye come together in the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} I hear that there are divisions among you; and I partly believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is expedient that there also be heresies among you, so that those who are proved may become manifest among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that when ye come together in one place, this is not eating the Lord’s supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in eating, each one takes his own supper first: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Do ye not have houses to eat and to drink in? or do ye despise the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God and shame those that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he had given thanks, he broke it and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you; this do in remembrance of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the same manner also he took the cup, after he had eaten supper, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood; do this each time that ye drink, in remembrance of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each time that ye eat this bread and drink this cup, ye declare the Lord’s death until he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever shall eat this bread and drink this cup of the Lord unworthily shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let each man prove himself, and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that eats and drinks unworthily, eats and drinks judgment to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we would examine ourselves, we should not be judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But being judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my brothers, when ye come together to eat, wait for one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home; that ye not come together unto judgment. And I will set the rest in order when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now regarding spiritual things, brothers, I would not have you ignore them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye know that when ye were Gentiles, ye went, even as ye were led, unto the dumb idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I give you to understand, that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus anathema and that no one can call Jesus Lord but by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is dispersal of gifts, but the same Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is dispersal of ministries, but the same Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is dispersal of operations, but it is the same God who works all in each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one to profit with.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to one is given by the Spirit a word of wisdom; to another, a word of knowledge according to the same Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another, faith by the same Spirit; to another, gifts of healing by the same Spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to another, the operation of miracles; to another, prophecy; to another, discerning of spirits; to another, different kinds of tongues; to another, the interpretation of tongues:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one and the same Spirit operates all these things, dispersing to each one his own gift as he wills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the body is one and has many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body, so also the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by one Spirit we are all baptized into one body, whether we are Jews or Greeks, whether we are slaves or free, and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the body is not one member, but many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the foot shall say, Because I am not a hand, I am not of the body, is it therefore not of the body?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not an eye, I am not of the body, is it therefore not of the body?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were hearing, where would the smelling be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now God has set the members each one of them in the body, as it has pleased him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they were all one member, where would the body be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now they are indeed many members, yet but one body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee; nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those members of the body, which seem to be weaker, are much more necessary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those members of the body which we think to be more vile, these we dress with more abundant honour; and those in us who are more indecent have more honesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those in us who are more honest need nothing, but God has ordered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that one which lacked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that there should be no contradiction in the body, but that the members should have the same care one for another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if one member suffers, all the members suffer together; or if one member is honoured, all the members rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now ye are the body of Christ and members in particular.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God did set certain ones in the congregation: {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that faculties, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? do all have faculties?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do all have gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But earnestly pursue the best gifts, and yet I show unto you a more excellent way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass or a tinkling cymbal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though I have the gift of prophecy and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor and though I give my body to be burned and have not charity, it profits me nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Charity suffers long and is benign; charity envies not; charity does nothing without due reason, is not puffed up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: is not injurious, seeks not her own, is not easily provoked, thinks no evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rejoices not in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Charity is never lost, but prophecies shall come to an end, tongues shall cease, and knowledge shall come to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we see as through a mirror, in darkness, but then we shall see face to face; now I know in part, but then I shall know even as I also am known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now abide faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow after charity and earnestly pursue spiritual gifts, but above all, that ye may prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he that speaks in an unknown tongue speaks not unto men, but unto God, for no one understands him, even though by the Spirit he speaks mysteries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that prophesies speaks unto men for edification and exhortation and comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaks in an unknown tongue edifies himself, but he that prophesies edifies the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would that ye all spoke with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied, for greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks with tongues, unless he interprets, that the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} may receive edifying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, brothers, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you unless I speak to you either with revelation or with knowledge or with prophecy or with doctrine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even things without life giving sound, whether flute or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is played or harped?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the trumpet gives an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue a clear and definite word, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall speak into the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many kinds of distinct voices in the world, and nothing is dumb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if I ignore the virtue of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaks as a barbarian, and he that speaks shall be a barbarian unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye desire the things of the Spirit, earnestly pursue excellence unto the edification of the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, let him that speaks in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also; I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupies the place of the ignorant say, Amen, at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understands not what thou sayest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet in the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, be not children in understanding, howbeit in malice be ye children; but in understanding be perfect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the law it is written, In other tongues and with other lips I will speak unto this people; and yet for all that, they will not hear me, saith the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, tongues are for a sign, not to those that believe, but to those that do not believe; but prophecy is not for those that do not believe, but for those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, therefore, the whole congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} is come together into one place and all speak with tongues, and there come in those that are unlearned or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that does not believe or one unlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the secrets of his heart are made manifest; and so falling down on his face, he will worship God, declaring that God is indeed in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it then, brothers? when ye come together, each one of you has a psalm, has doctrine, has tongues, has revelation, has interpretation. Let all things be done unto edification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and that by course; and let one interpret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silence in the congregation, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} and let him speak to himself and to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the others judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any thing is revealed to another that sits by, let the first be silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be exhorted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is not the God of disorder, but of peace, as in all the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your women keep silence in the congregations, {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but they are commanded to be in subjection, as also saith the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they desire to learn anything, let them ask their husbands at home, for it is a dishonest thing for women to speak in the congregation. {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What? Did the word of God come out from you? or did it come unto you only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anyone that ignores them shall be ignored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers, earnestly pursue prophecy and do not forbid to speak with tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, brothers, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received and in which ye stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by which also ye are being saved if ye retain the word that I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received: how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he was buried and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he appeared to Cephas and then to the twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after that, he appeared unto more than five hundred brothers at once, of whom the greater part remain unto now, but some are fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, he appeared unto James; then to all the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And last of all he appeared unto me also, as of one born out of due time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the least of the apostles, for I am not worthy to be called an apostle because I persecuted the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am; and his grace towards me was not in vain, for I laboured more abundantly than they all, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, whether it were I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the Christ is preached that rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then neither is Christ risen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if Christ is not risen, then our preaching is vain, and your faith is also vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are even found false witnesses of God because we have testified of God that he raised up the Christ, whom he did not raise up, if it so be that the dead do not rise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the dead do not rise, then Christ is not raised either;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if Christ is not raised, your faith is vain; ye are even yet in your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those also who are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If in this life only we have existence in Christ, we are the most miserable of all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now Christ is risen from the dead and become the firstfruits of those that slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since by a man came death, by a man came also the resurrection of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in Adam all die, even so in the Christ shall all be made alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each one in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward, those that are Christ’s at his coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then comes the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father, when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he must reign until he has put all enemies under his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has put all things under his feet. But when he says all things are put under him, it is clear that he is excepted, who did put all things under him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also subject himself unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Else what shall they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why do we stand in jeopardy every hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I die daily to stay in the glory of having taught you, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what does it advantage me, if the dead do not rise? let us eat and drink; for tomorrow we die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not deceived: evil companions corrupt good character.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch diligently, and sin not; for some do not know God: I speak this to your shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not brought to life, unless it dies first;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but bare grain: it may be of wheat or of some other grain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God gives it a body as it has pleased him, and to each seed its own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are also heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, but the heavenly glory is one thing, and the earthly glory is another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One thing is the glory of the sun, and another the glory of the moon, and another the glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it shall be raised in incorruption;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is sown in dishonour, it shall be raised with glory; it is sown in weakness, it shall be raised with power;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is sown a natural body, it shall be raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a life-giving Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howbeit the spiritual is not first, but the natural; and afterward, that which is spiritual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first man is of the earth, earthy; the second man is the Lord of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As is the earthy, such are those also that are earthy; and as is the heavenly, such also are those that are heavenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I say, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither does corruption inherit incorruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I show you a mystery: We shall all indeed be raised, but we shall not all be changed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet, for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised without corruption, and we shall be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the word that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O death, where is thy sting? O Hades, where is thy victory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be ye steadfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given orders to the congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of Galatia, do ye likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each first sabbath let each one of you set aside in store, as God has prospered him, that there be no collections when I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I come, whomever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it is appropriate that I go also, they shall go with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will come unto you, when I have passed through Macedonia, for I must pass through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it may be that I will abide and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey wherever I go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I desire not to see you now in passing, but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a great and effectual door is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if Timothy comes, see that he may stay with you securely, for he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man therefore despise him, but conduct him forth in peace that he may come unto me, for I look for him with the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with some of the brothers, but his will was not at all to come at this time, but he will come when he shall have opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, be brave, be strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all your things be done with charity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beseech you, brethren (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia and that they have dedicated themselves to the ministry of the saints),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye submit yourselves unto such and to each one that helps and labours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus, for they have filled your absence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours; therefore, acknowledge ye those that are such.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The congregations {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} that is in their house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the brothers greet you. Greet ye one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The salutation of me, Paul, is with my own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be anathema. Our Lord has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My charity in Christ Jesus be with you all. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
